body_html:
This would be a really involved change, since we passively rely on dagre for layout of the graph. If we took a naive approach to adding draggable nodes, it would reset every time the user collapsed or expanded a node.

It may be there are simpler approaches for solving your problem, e.g. filtering out certain subsections of the graph so that it is easier to display and understand. In any case, I am going to mark this issue "Contributions Welcome" in case someone else wants to take it on, but adding manual graph layout is not on our roadmap.

body:
This would be a really involved change, since we passively rely on dagre for layout of the graph. If we took a naive approach to adding draggable nodes, it would reset every time the user collapsed or expanded a node. 

It may be there are simpler approaches for solving your problem, e.g. filtering out certain subsections of the graph so that it is easier to display and understand. In any case, I am going to mark this issue "Contributions Welcome" in case someone else wants to take it on, but adding manual graph layout is not on our roadmap.
